sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: The View Transitions API is a new — but game-changing — feature that allows us to do the types of reactive state-based UI and page transitions that have traditionally been exclusive to JavaScript frameworks. In the second half of this mini two-part series, Adrian Bece expands on the demos from the first article to demonstrate how the View Transitions API can be used to transition not just elements between two states but the transition between full views and pages in single-page and multi-page applications.
articles.title: The View Transitions API And Delightful UI Animations (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s start into the new year with a little inspiration boost: wallpapers created with love by the community for the community. Happy 2024!
articles.title: The Magic Of New Beginnings (January 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: JavaScript may be the most popular client-side language in the world, but it’s far from perfect and not without its quirks. Juan Diego Rodriguez examines several “absurd” JavaScript eccentricities and explains how they made it into the language as well as how to avoid them in your own code.
articles.title: Making Sense Of “Senseless” JavaScript Features

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: The View Transitions API is a new — but game-changing — feature that allows us to do the types of reactive state-based UI and page transitions that have traditionally been exclusive to JavaScript frameworks. In the first part of this mini two-part series, Adrian Bece thoroughly explains why we need the API and demonstrates its basic usage.
articles.title: The View Transitions API And Delightful UI Animations (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Šime Vidas)
articles.description: Since the introduction of CSS viewport units in 2012, many of us have been using `width: 100vw` as a way to set an element’s width to the full width of the viewport. But, as Šime Vidas explains in this deep dive, `100vw` does not always represent the full width of the viewport due to differences in how browsers handle scrollbars.
articles.title: New CSS Viewport Units Do Not Solve The Classic Scrollbar Problem

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: Part 2 concentrates on the key points from Luis’ framework and practical tips about managing a design system that should be both robust and easy to adopt.
articles.title: Building Components For Consumption, Not Complexity (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Brecht De Ruyte)
articles.description: Have you run into a situation where you need the padding of one element to align with the padding of another element? In this article, Brecht De Ruyte demonstrates the issue with a full-width slider component that breaks out of the main page container and shares a couple of techniques to keep it visually aligned with other elements on the page.
articles.title: CSS Scroll Snapping Aligned With Global Page Layout: A Full-Width Slider Case Study

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: Design systems can be of immense help, but failure to adopt them invalidates the hard work that goes into building the thing in the first place! In this two-part series of articles, Luis shares his experience with design systems and how you can overcome the potential pitfalls.
articles.title: Building Components For Consumption, Not Complexity (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: Starting in March 2024, Interaction to Next Paint will formally replace First Input Delay as a Core Web Vital metric. Learn how the two metrics differ, why we needed a new way to measure interaction responsiveness, and how you can start optimizing the performance of your site now for a seamless transition to the latest Core Web Vital metric.
articles.title: Preparing For Interaction To Next Paint, A New Web Core Vital

articles.author: Elizabeth  Meshioye
articles.description: Sometimes you might want to use a different select element to match your style based on the theme of your design. Or perhaps the default design is different on separate browsers and you want uniformity.  But when designing this new element, you might forget to consider the accessibility of
articles.title: How to Build an Accessible Custom Dropdown Select Element

articles.author: Destiny Erhabor
articles.description: Go, also known as Golang, is a statically-typed, compiled programming language designed for simplicity and efficiency.  When it comes to working with data structures like slices, maps, and channels, you'll likely encounter the new() and make() functions. While both are used for memory allocation, they serve distinct purposes.
articles.title: The new() vs make() Functions in Go – When to Use Each One

articles.author: Nathan Sebhastian
articles.description: Hi Everyone! In this article, I'm going to teach you how to use three advanced JavaScript operators: the Nullish Coalescing, Optional Chaining, and Destructuring Assignment operators. These three operators will help you write clearer and less error-prone code.  The Nullish Coalescing Operator When you’re inspecting JavaScript code, you may
articles.title: Advanced JavaScript Operators – Nullish Coalescing, Optional Chaining, and Destructuring Assignment

articles.author: SUDHEER KUMAR REDDY GOWRIGARI
articles.description: In the ever-evolving landscape of web development, performance optimization remains a top priority.  Among the plethora of strategies you can use to enhance web performance, lazy loading stands out for its efficiency and impact.  But what exactly is lazy loading, and how does it revolutionize the way we
articles.title: How Lazy Loading Works in Web Development

articles.author: Chris Blakely
articles.description: Have you ever wondered how modern web applications are built? How you can learn and master the technologies that you can use to build your own full stack projects from scratch? In this handbook, I'm going to introduce you to the MERN stack, a widely-used technology stack embraced by many
articles.title: MERN Stack Roadmap – How to Learn MERN and Become a Full-Stack Developer

articles.author: Zubair Idris Aweda
articles.description: As the digital landscape continues to evolve and technology marches forward, cloud computing has remained an important topic for developers to learn. You've probably encountered cloud requirements in job listings, heard people talk about it in conversations, or seen ads by companies offering cloud services – and now you're interested
articles.title: What is Cloud Computing? Introduction to the Cloud for Beginners

articles.author: CHRISTINE T. BELZIE
articles.description: Imagine a beautiful cherry tree full of sweet, red, round fruit hanging on lush, glistening branches. But imagine if those cherries grew so quickly that the branches started bending, overlapping, and breaking...sounds chaotic right?  This is what can happen if you don't use Git's cherry-pick command properly in open
articles.title: How to Use Git Cherry Pick and Avoid Duplicate Commits

articles.author: Abraham Dahunsi
articles.description: Protecting sensitive data like API keys, passwords, and certificates in your Docker projects can be quite daunting and error-prone. And many devs neglect it when dealing with applications deployed in containers. There is no global way of storing and sharing secrets in containers. Traditional methods of storing them, such as
articles.title: How to Manage Secrets in Docker

articles.author: Kedar Makode
articles.description: Welcome to the fundamental world of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)! In order to be an effective Linux user, you'll need to learn and truly understand some essential concepts and commands. Let's dive into the core aspects of RHEL administration to help you understand these key topics that form the
articles.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux – Essential RHEL Concepts and Commands to Know

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: React and Appwrite make a great combination for creating full stack apps.  We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to use React and Appwrite to create full stack applications. This course is designed and delivered by Hitesh Choudhary, a excellent instructor
articles.title: Comprehensive Full Stack React with Appwrite – Tutorial
